title: 44 Best Housewarming Gifts to Get You Welcomed Back in 2025
description: From registry-worthy dishware to budget-friendly plants and accessories
author: Audrey Lee, Kate McGregor
excerpt: Looking for the best housewarming gifts? Check out our fave picks that say “congrats,” including towels, cutting boards, diffusers, glassware, and more!
text: Yes, the best housewarming gifts should ideally be useful, but that doesn’t mean you should skimp on the charm and whimsy factor completely. Whether you’re bestowing something special upon a pal who’s moving into a new apartment or their first house, a vibe-enhancing and aesthetically pleasing present goes a long way to make the place feel more like home (and an elevated home at that).With that in mind, we’ve rounded up the best housewarming gifts—many of which have blessed our own spaces—at different price points. You’ll find practical items such as weighted blankets, decorative pieces like chic candleholders, and from-the-heart gifts like houseplants for welcoming vibes (everyone loves a money tree!). Here are some of our absolute favorites for kicking off a whole new era of homeownership, domestic bliss, or rental freedom.Our Top Picks for the Best Housewarming GiftsBest Budget-Friendly Gift: Le Creuset Signature Stoneware Oil & Vinegar Set, $52Best Plant Gift: Money Tree Plant, $74Best Cozy Gift: Bearaby Cotton Napper, $249Best Gadget Gift: SMEG Slice Toaster, $200Best Splurge: KitchenAid Artisan Stand Mixer, $350Browse According to Category:Gifts Under $50 | Gifts Under $100 | Splurge GiftsGifts Under $50Ferm Living Harbour Fish HookWhether you live in a shoebox apartment or a single-family home, there is no such thing as too much storage. These fishy wall hooks serve as an adorable alternative to standard metal hooks or coat racks.Lichen NYC Galvanized Wall Bud VasePlant enthusiasts know the struggle of running out of surface area for greenery collections, propagation vases, and flower buds. Offer them a home for their latest bloom away from the already crowded side table or bookshelf. This steel bud vase from Lichen NYC easily screws into the wall, no anchors needed.Anthropologie Icon Juice GlassYou can never go wrong with gifting a cute set of glassware. Choose the icon you feel best represents your friend for a personalized approach to housewarming. Are they more lucky horseshoes or cherries? Evil eyes or pickleball rackets? The humorous low-balls will surely become a fast favorite.NYT "Cultured Traveler" Coffee Table BookIf your companion is the type to only be home during the work week or is always jetting off to remote destinations, this coffee table book is a winning gift. Offering 100 stories of inspiring travel destinations (as well as where to stay, eat, and visit), the New York Times writers behind this tome have designed the ideal getaway for every type of traveler, whether you prefer urban oases or off-the-grid resets."The Wishbone Kitchen Cookbook" by Meredith HaydenFor the avid host, a new cookbook can spark a season of fresh dinner party themes and potluck delicacies. Meredith Hayden, the chef and social media personality behind the viral Wishbone Kitchen accounts, developed 100 recipes from breakfast to dessert, inspired by her culinary career.Aesop Aromatique Hand WashFunctional and always needed, you can never have enough hand soap. And while Aesop is definitely a splurge for everyday, it’s the kind of purchase we’d never make for ourselves, which makes it an ideal housewarming gift.Boy Smells Hinoki Fantôme CandleBoy Smells’ Hinoki Fantôme is a uniquely wood-based candle gift that will curate a warm and earthy vibe. Don’t be surprised if this becomes the signature scent for their new house.The Sill Mini OrchidBring good tidings to any new homeowner with a beautiful potted Phalaenopsis orchid. This one from The Sill is available in five different variations, though we suggest a yellow one to signify new beginnings, or a pink one meant to represent happiness and joy.Wildflower Monogram Notecard SetMark their move with beautiful custom stationary to make their new chapter that more official. If they’re big on the lost art of the letter and handwritten thank-yous, bringing this to the housewarming party is a no-brainer.Victoria Cast Iron SkilletA cast-iron skillet is another highly giftable choice. This Amazon find is a bestseller, with thousands of rave reviews (and even a glowing endorsement from Epicurious).The Mug by East ForkAfter a chaotic move, your friend might be left with mismatched drinkware. Give them a fresh start with a few of East Fork’s elegant 12-ounce mugs. Seen here in a deep wine hue, the set is also available in several other shades. (And there are matching bowls and plates, should you feel inclined to add on.)CB2 Kira Hand Etched Martini GlassAfter moving to a new space, the bar cart might be screaming for updated glassware. These glasses will give espresso martinis added flair.Ellepi Klizia 97 StaplerMade in Italy, this powder-coated stapler makes a practical, colorful addition to any home office. Colors include bright navy, mustard yellow, and kelly green.Toyo Y-350 Steel Mountain Tool BoxIt’s not often that we come across a tool box that is actually attractive. This model from Japanese brand Toyo is just the right size for essentials, from screwdrivers to levels to measuring tape.Gifts Under $100Schoolhouse x Clare V Yves CatchallEvery home needs a drop zone—a place to dump your keys, spare change, and sunglasses as you come in the front door. This catchall from Los Angeles–based fashion designer Clare V.’s collaboration with Schoolhouse is available in a handful of vibrant colors, but we’re partial to the design-forward Yves Klein Blue.Tart by Taylor Scalloped Picture FrameDisplaying personal effects can quickly make the sparseness of a new house into a true home. Picture frames are a tried-and-true housewarming gift. This scalloped-edge frame offers a fun twist on the typically square or rectangular shapes.Flamingo Estate Oil & Vinegar Gift SetFor the amateur chef in your friend group, help them get a head start on their new home’s kitchen essentials. Flamingo Estate is known for their homegrown pantry wares, and this oil and vinegar gift set includes a California-grown olive oil and persimmon vinegar. In a rush? This set comes prewrapped for a low-maintenance presentation.Gohar World Shell Napkin Ring SetPlay into their predilection for kitschy-chic decor with delicate shell napkin rings from Gohar World. Showing up with these will likely seal your invite to their upcoming dinner party.Rock Pool Dance Print by Moira FrithIf they’ve got empty walls to fill, a cheery watercolor print by artist Moira Frith makes an excellent gift. Some prints are inspired by her observations of the rock pools and shallow waters along the English coast, while other prints from the series feature playful botanicals and whimsical dancers.Sabre Paris Bistrot Faux Horn Cutlery SetChannel a French café vibe with this elevated cutlery set from Parisian label Sabre.Rejuvenation Stafford Woven Round BasketA gorgeous basket can pull double duty as storage and home decor and looks good just about everywhere. This high-quality find is a perfect housewarming gift on its own, or you can assemble it as a gift basket by adding special treats. (Think a throw blanket and page-turning novel, a bottle of wine and wineglasses, or a cutting board and artisanal cheeses—anything goes!)Zia Pia Fantasia Galantino Olive OilImported olive oil always makes for a thoughtful gift—especially when it comes in a hand-painted ceramic vessel that's heirloom material.vase - 16 (2018) Screenprint by Antic-HamA bouquet is fail-safe when it comes to a great housewarming present—but their favorite florals in artwork form on a gallery wall? Doubly meaningful.Le Creuset Stoneware French PressAny coffee enthusiast will treasure a high-quality French press, and we’re partial to this design from Le Creuset. Seen here in Caribbean blue, the kitchen must-have is also fetching in cherry and “artichaut” green.Alessi B Salt CastorAdding just a pinch of salt will feel very luxurious with Alessi’s perforated salt castor.Alessi Pulcina Stovetop Coffee MakerFeed their caffeine addiction with style by showing up to a housewarming with a sleek-looking coffee maker and a bag of their favorite French roast.Splurge GiftsRails Cashmere Throw in AlabasterComfy blankets make trusty companions—no matter if your friend is a bookworm who’s into hygge or binging Oscar-nominated films. This cashmere design from Rails is woven with a subtle checkered pattern for extra visual appeal.Beata Heuman Monster PinchSalt cellars have risen in popularity over the last few years, and the designs of these humble culinary staples have only gotten more imaginative. This version from AD100 designer Beata Heuman makes for a cute kitchen companion.Big Night Big Nights PlannerIf your friend prefers to have people over rather than go out, give them the gift of organization with this leather-bound party planner. With pages designed to put together menus, sort out seating arrangements, and even sections for florals and guest lists, this notebook is a dream for type-A hosts.Flamingo Estate Tomato Bath SetMoving is stressful, so encourage your friend to take time for self-care by gifting them a bath set from Flamingo Estate in their popular tomato scent. Including a candle, hand soap, and body lotion, this set has everything you need for a soothing night in. Unpacking those final few boxes can wait.Mykonos Muse by Lizy ManolaNo list of the best housewarming gifts is complete without a statement coffee-table book. Mykonos Muse, from Assouline, is a bestseller and one of our favorites. Aside from its striking cover, you’ll love the wanderlust-inspiring images of the famed Greek island that fill 300 glossy pages.Oyster PlateMove over cheese boards—it’s all about oyster platters in 2025. This dishware looks like it was plucked right off of Gwyneth Paltrow’s kitchen wall and will definitely get a ton of use if they're serious about Oyster Fridays.Diptyque Mimosa Reed DiffuserDiptyque’s Mimosa scent is inspired by the scent of mimosa flowers that bloom in the South of France: tart, slightly spicy, and citrusy. Paired with rattan reeds and a glass vase, it’s a new home gift that anyone will appreciate.Bearaby Cotton Napper (15lbs)A weighted blanket is a thoughtful housewarming gift that might relieve some of the post-move stress. The Bearaby Cotton Napper is one of our favorite weighted blankets year after year, and you can get it in midnight blue, white, dark gray (pictured), light gray, and blush. It’s also available in velvet if your giftee likes things a bit more luxe.Smeg 2 Slice ToasterThey’ll be able to get the perfect crunch on bread, bagels, and english muffins thanks to Smeg’s aesthetically pleasing toaster that looks like something straight out of the Jetsons.Hand Sculpted Conch Shell Speaker by Lucy SchaefferFor the low-tech loved ones among us, here’s a conch-shaped sculpture that cradles their smartphone, amplifying its existing speaker. It doubles as a piece of art when not in use.KitchenAid Artisan Stand MixerThe KitchenAid Pro Mixer is definitely a splurge, but it does come recommended by just about every professional baker—and several AD editors. These mixers are heavy-duty countertop eye candy, and they come in just about every shade of the rainbow so it’s one of those housewarming gift ideas that’ll delight any baker.Maison Balzac Green 'The Olive Bottle' CruetFor a luxe for less trick, add Trader Joe’s EVOO into this whimsical olive-adorned container from Maison Balzac.Cangshan HAKU Series Steak Knife SetFresh knives will have their new kitchen looking sharp, and this snazzy gift set is one of the absolute best knife sets. With blades forged from 67 layers of Damascus steel complemented by African blackwood handles, these knives are designed equally for style and durability. Each set comes with an oak wood box that fits into a drawer.Our Place Always Pan 2.0The Always Pan is always trending among our readers, and it is most definitely one of the best housewarming gifts we can think of, especially for foodies. This pan does everything: It fries, sautés, and steams, plus it’s nonstick and easy to clean.Alessi Pepper MillA few cracks of fresh black pepper finish the dish—using Alessi’s elevated pepper mill, of course.Courant Catch:3 Wireless Phone Charging TrayA great gift for the entryway. html:
Yes, the best housewarming gifts should ideally be useful, but that doesn’t mean you should skimp on the charm and whimsy factor completely. Whether you’re bestowing something special upon a pal who’s moving into a new apartment or their first house, a vibe-enhancing and aesthetically pleasing present goes a long way to make the place feel more like home (and an elevated home at that).

With that in mind, we’ve rounded up the best housewarming gifts—many of which have blessed our own spaces—at different price points. You’ll find practical items such as weighted blankets, decorative pieces like chic candleholders, and from-the-heart gifts like houseplants for welcoming vibes (everyone loves a money tree!). Here are some of our absolute favorites for kicking off a whole new era of homeownership, domestic bliss, or rental freedom.

Our Top Picks for the Best Housewarming Gifts

  • Best Budget-Friendly Gift: Le Creuset Signature Stoneware Oil & Vinegar Set, $52
  • Best Plant Gift: Money Tree Plant, $74
  • Best Cozy Gift: Bearaby Cotton Napper, $249
  • Best Gadget Gift: SMEG Slice Toaster, $200
  • Best Splurge: KitchenAid Artisan Stand Mixer, $350

Browse According to Category:

Gifts Under $50 | Gifts Under $100 | Splurge Gifts

Gifts Under $50

Ferm Living Harbour Fish Hook

Whether you live in a shoebox apartment or a single-family home, there is no such thing as too much storage. These fishy wall hooks serve as an adorable alternative to standard metal hooks or coat racks.

Lichen NYC Galvanized Wall Bud Vase

Plant enthusiasts know the struggle of running out of surface area for greenery collections, propagation vases, and flower buds. Offer them a home for their latest bloom away from the already crowded side table or bookshelf. This steel bud vase from Lichen NYC easily screws into the wall, no anchors needed.

Anthropologie Icon Juice Glass

You can never go wrong with gifting a cute set of glassware. Choose the icon you feel best represents your friend for a personalized approach to housewarming. Are they more lucky horseshoes or cherries? Evil eyes or pickleball rackets? The humorous low-balls will surely become a fast favorite.

NYT "Cultured Traveler" Coffee Table Book

If your companion is the type to only be home during the work week or is always jetting off to remote destinations, this coffee table book is a winning gift. Offering 100 stories of inspiring travel destinations (as well as where to stay, eat, and visit), the New York Times writers behind this tome have designed the ideal getaway for every type of traveler, whether you prefer urban oases or off-the-grid resets.

"The Wishbone Kitchen Cookbook" by Meredith Hayden

For the avid host, a new cookbook can spark a season of fresh dinner party themes and potluck delicacies. Meredith Hayden, the chef and social media personality behind the viral Wishbone Kitchen accounts, developed 100 recipes from breakfast to dessert, inspired by her culinary career.

Aesop Aromatique Hand Wash

Functional and always needed, you can never have enough hand soap. And while Aesop is definitely a splurge for everyday, it’s the kind of purchase we’d never make for ourselves, which makes it an ideal housewarming gift.

Boy Smells Hinoki Fantôme Candle

Boy Smells’ Hinoki Fantôme is a uniquely wood-based candle gift that will curate a warm and earthy vibe. Don’t be surprised if this becomes the signature scent for their new house.

The Sill Mini Orchid

Bring good tidings to any new homeowner with a beautiful potted Phalaenopsis orchid. This one from The Sill is available in five different variations, though we suggest a yellow one to signify new beginnings, or a pink one meant to represent happiness and joy.

Wildflower Monogram Notecard Set

Mark their move with beautiful custom stationary to make their new chapter that more official. If they’re big on the lost art of the letter and handwritten thank-yous, bringing this to the housewarming party is a no-brainer.

Victoria Cast Iron Skillet

A cast-iron skillet is another highly giftable choice. This Amazon find is a bestseller, with thousands of rave reviews (and even a glowing endorsement from Epicurious).

The Mug by East Fork

After a chaotic move, your friend might be left with mismatched drinkware. Give them a fresh start with a few of East Fork’s elegant 12-ounce mugs. Seen here in a deep wine hue, the set is also available in several other shades. (And there are matching bowls and plates, should you feel inclined to add on.)

CB2 Kira Hand Etched Martini Glass

After moving to a new space, the bar cart might be screaming for updated glassware. These glasses will give espresso martinis added flair.

Ellepi Klizia 97 Stapler

Made in Italy, this powder-coated stapler makes a practical, colorful addition to any home office. Colors include bright navy, mustard yellow, and kelly green.

Toyo Y-350 Steel Mountain Tool Box

It’s not often that we come across a tool box that is actually attractive. This model from Japanese brand Toyo is just the right size for essentials, from screwdrivers to levels to measuring tape.

Gifts Under $100

Schoolhouse x Clare V Yves Catchall

Every home needs a drop zone—a place to dump your keys, spare change, and sunglasses as you come in the front door. This catchall from Los Angeles–based fashion designer Clare V.’s collaboration with Schoolhouse is available in a handful of vibrant colors, but we’re partial to the design-forward Yves Klein Blue.

Tart by Taylor Scalloped Picture Frame

Displaying personal effects can quickly make the sparseness of a new house into a true home. Picture frames are a tried-and-true housewarming gift. This scalloped-edge frame offers a fun twist on the typically square or rectangular shapes.

Flamingo Estate Oil & Vinegar Gift Set

For the amateur chef in your friend group, help them get a head start on their new home’s kitchen essentials. Flamingo Estate is known for their homegrown pantry wares, and this oil and vinegar gift set includes a California-grown olive oil and persimmon vinegar. In a rush? This set comes prewrapped for a low-maintenance presentation.

Gohar World Shell Napkin Ring Set

Play into their predilection for kitschy-chic decor with delicate shell napkin rings from Gohar World. Showing up with these will likely seal your invite to their upcoming dinner party.

Rock Pool Dance Print by Moira Frith

If they’ve got empty walls to fill, a cheery watercolor print by artist Moira Frith makes an excellent gift. Some prints are inspired by her observations of the rock pools and shallow waters along the English coast, while other prints from the series feature playful botanicals and whimsical dancers.

Sabre Paris Bistrot Faux Horn Cutlery Set

Channel a French café vibe with this elevated cutlery set from Parisian label Sabre.

Rejuvenation Stafford Woven Round Basket

A gorgeous basket can pull double duty as storage and home decor and looks good just about everywhere. This high-quality find is a perfect housewarming gift on its own, or you can assemble it as a gift basket by adding special treats. (Think a throw blanket and page-turning novel, a bottle of wine and wineglasses, or a cutting board and artisanal cheeses—anything goes!)

Zia Pia Fantasia Galantino Olive Oil

Imported olive oil always makes for a thoughtful gift—especially when it comes in a hand-painted ceramic vessel that's heirloom material.

vase - 16 (2018) Screenprint by Antic-Ham

A bouquet is fail-safe when it comes to a great housewarming present—but their favorite florals in artwork form on a gallery wall? Doubly meaningful.

Le Creuset Stoneware French Press

Any coffee enthusiast will treasure a high-quality French press, and we’re partial to this design from Le Creuset. Seen here in Caribbean blue, the kitchen must-have is also fetching in cherry and “artichaut” green.

Alessi B Salt Castor

Adding just a pinch of salt will feel very luxurious with Alessi’s perforated salt castor.

Alessi Pulcina Stovetop Coffee Maker

Feed their caffeine addiction with style by showing up to a housewarming with a sleek-looking coffee maker and a bag of their favorite French roast.

Splurge Gifts

Rails Cashmere Throw in Alabaster

Comfy blankets make trusty companions—no matter if your friend is a bookworm who’s into hygge or binging Oscar-nominated films. This cashmere design from Rails is woven with a subtle checkered pattern for extra visual appeal.

Beata Heuman Monster Pinch

Salt cellars have risen in popularity over the last few years, and the designs of these humble culinary staples have only gotten more imaginative. This version from AD100 designer Beata Heuman makes for a cute kitchen companion.

Big Night Big Nights Planner

If your friend prefers to have people over rather than go out, give them the gift of organization with this leather-bound party planner. With pages designed to put together menus, sort out seating arrangements, and even sections for florals and guest lists, this notebook is a dream for type-A hosts.

Flamingo Estate Tomato Bath Set

Moving is stressful, so encourage your friend to take time for self-care by gifting them a bath set from Flamingo Estate in their popular tomato scent. Including a candle, hand soap, and body lotion, this set has everything you need for a soothing night in. Unpacking those final few boxes can wait.

Mykonos Muse by Lizy Manola

No list of the best housewarming gifts is complete without a statement coffee-table book. Mykonos Muse, from Assouline, is a bestseller and one of our favorites. Aside from its striking cover, you’ll love the wanderlust-inspiring images of the famed Greek island that fill 300 glossy pages.

Oyster Plate

Move over cheese boards—it’s all about oyster platters in 2025. This dishware looks like it was plucked right off of Gwyneth Paltrow’s kitchen wall and will definitely get a ton of use if they're serious about Oyster Fridays.

Diptyque Mimosa Reed Diffuser

Diptyque’s Mimosa scent is inspired by the scent of mimosa flowers that bloom in the South of France: tart, slightly spicy, and citrusy. Paired with rattan reeds and a glass vase, it’s a new home gift that anyone will appreciate.

Bearaby Cotton Napper (15lbs)

A weighted blanket is a thoughtful housewarming gift that might relieve some of the post-move stress. The Bearaby Cotton Napper is one of our favorite weighted blankets year after year, and you can get it in midnight blue, white, dark gray (pictured), light gray, and blush. It’s also available in velvet if your giftee likes things a bit more luxe.

Smeg 2 Slice Toaster

They’ll be able to get the perfect crunch on bread, bagels, and english muffins thanks to Smeg’s aesthetically pleasing toaster that looks like something straight out of the Jetsons.

Hand Sculpted Conch Shell Speaker by Lucy Schaeffer

For the low-tech loved ones among us, here’s a conch-shaped sculpture that cradles their smartphone, amplifying its existing speaker. It doubles as a piece of art when not in use.

KitchenAid Artisan Stand Mixer

The KitchenAid Pro Mixer is definitely a splurge, but it does come recommended by just about every professional baker—and several AD editors. These mixers are heavy-duty countertop eye candy, and they come in just about every shade of the rainbow so it’s one of those housewarming gift ideas that’ll delight any baker.

Maison Balzac Green 'The Olive Bottle' Cruet

For a luxe for less trick, add Trader Joe’s EVOO into this whimsical olive-adorned container from Maison Balzac.

Cangshan HAKU Series Steak Knife Set

Fresh knives will have their new kitchen looking sharp, and this snazzy gift set is one of the absolute best knife sets. With blades forged from 67 layers of Damascus steel complemented by African blackwood handles, these knives are designed equally for style and durability. Each set comes with an oak wood box that fits into a drawer.

Our Place Always Pan 2.0

The Always Pan is always trending among our readers, and it is most definitely one of the best housewarming gifts we can think of, especially for foodies. This pan does everything: It fries, sautés, and steams, plus it’s nonstick and easy to clean.

Alessi Pepper Mill

A few cracks of fresh black pepper finish the dish—using Alessi’s elevated pepper mill, of course.

Courant Catch:3 Wireless Phone Charging Tray

A great gift for the entryway. This sleek catchall tray keeps track of their keys while also charging devices like their phone. No more running out the door without a full battery.

Maison Balzac Iris Flutes (Set of 2)

Toast to the new space with these striking stemmed coupes. The 100% Borosilicate glass design was inspired by actual irises. Glassware this pretty demands to be displayed on an open shelf or bar cart!

Sophie Lou Jacobsen Cosmo Coupe (Set of 4)

For all the champagne toasts to come, SLJ’s coupe set feels special enough to mark any big occasion or milestone.

CB2 Orcino Green Marble Fruit Bowl

Sure, this marble bowl is technically designated for fruit, but we think that it’d make anything—from sweets to rolls—look equally nice.

East Fork Glass Colorblock Serving Spoon Set

Serving up salads and main courses will feel very Alice in Wonderland, thanks to this striking spoon set.
